channel.title: Events on CHIPS Alliance
channel.description: Recent content in Events on CHIPS Alliance

item.title: RISC-V at embedded world
item.description: RISC-V is a global standard available under an open, royalty-free license exhibiting at embedded world 2023 to highlight members and the broader RISC-V ecosystem.

item.title: Zephyr at embedded world
item.description: Visit The Zephyr® Project and various members at embedded world 2023 as we showcase the best-in-class RTOS for connected resource-constrained devices.

item.title: CHIPS Alliance Fall Workshop 2022
item.description: Check out the presentations below, and watch the replay here Porting Android to RISC-V Alibaba – Guoyin Chen and Han Mao, Alibaba (replay) Practical Adoption of Open Source System Verilog Tools – Michael Gielda, Antmicro (replay) Chisel and FIRRTL for Next-Generation SoC Designs– Jack Koenig, SiFive (replay) OpenFASOC: Automated Open Source Analog and Mixed-Signals IC Generation – Mehdi Saligane, University of Michigan (UMICH) (replay) FPGA Tooling Interoperability with the FPGA Interchange Format – Maciej Kurc, Antmicro (replay) OmniXtend: Scalability and LPC – Jaco Hofmann, Western Digital Corporation (replay) Open Source NVME IP with AI Acceleration – Anand Kulkarni, Western Digital Corporation and Karol Gugala, Antmicro (replay) Automating Analog Layout using ALIGN – Sachin Sapatnekar, University of Minnesota (UMN) (replay) Watch the Replay

item.title: CHIPS Alliance First 2022 Biannual Technology Update
item.description: Check out the presentations below: Introduction – Rob Mains, CHIPS Alliance Updates of Android on RISC-V – Han Mao, Alibaba Chisel and FIRRTL for Next-Generation SoC Designs– Jack Koenig, SiFive Introducting the F4PGA Workgroup– Michael Gielda, Karol Gugala, Antmicro Chiplet IP Protocol– Dave Kehlet, Intel NVMe Computational Storage Processor for Edge & Datacenter Applications, Anand Kulkarni, Wester Digital Towards Open Source Models of Cryogenic CMOS : Brian Hoskins and Pragya Shrestha, NIST Latest Statistics from Google’s No Cost Shuttle Program : Tim Ansell, Google Watch the Replay
